page.title: 16SECONDARY EDUCATION
page.content: Children leave the primary school at the end of Primary 7 when they are 11 years old. They then have to attend secondary school either at Lochaber High in Fort William or in the high school in Portree, Isle of Skye. The children from the small isles present a problem to the Education Authority because they are unable to get home at weekends because of the ferry service. Hostels are available at most Highland secondary schools for pupils who live too far away to travel in each day. However, most of these pupils can get home at weekends so the hostels shut then. This in effect means that children as young as 11 are homeless and without supervision at weekends. The parents therefore have to find adequate lodgings for their children.
